recipe.ingredients: 4 large bell peppers (any color), 1 pound ground turkey, 1 cup cooked quinoa, 1 (14.5-ounce) can no-salt-added diced tomatoes, drained, 1 cup chopped onions, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 teaspoon smoked paprika, 1 teaspoon dried oregano, 1/2 teaspoon cumin, 1/2 teaspoon chili powder, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, 1 cup shredded reduced-fat cheddar cheese, 1/2 cup low-sodium chicken broth, Fresh parsley for garnish
recipe.directions: Preheat oven to 350 F. Cut tops off bell peppers and remove seeds and membranes; set aside. In a skillet over medium heat, cook ground turkey, onions, and garlic until meat is no longer pink and onions are translucent. Drain any excess fat.,Stir in cooked quinoa, diced tomatoes, smoked paprika, oregano, cumin, chili powder, and black pepper into the skillet with the turkey. Cook for an additional 5 minutes.,Spoon the mixture into each bell pepper cavity and place them in a baking dish. Pour chicken broth into the bottom of the dish. Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 35 minutes.,Uncover, sprinkle with cheese, and bake for another 10 minutes until the cheese is melted and peppers are tender. Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.
recipe.nutrition: Calories 340, Total fat 9g, Saturated fat 3g, Trans fat 0g, Monounsaturated fat 2g, Cholesterol 80mg, Sodium 320mg, Total carbohydrate 29g, Dietary fiber 6g, Total sugars 8g, Protein 35g
